title.rendered: What options do we have besides Movistar?

content.rendered:
If you want to hire Internet in your town, we are going to review what options of Internet rates without permanence we have available in addition to Movistar. Sometimes, the fiber connection does not reach rural areas, so you have to look for alternatives to fiber optics such as satellite Internet, 4G at home or Wimax, which work through waves and you do not need to install anything in your home. home nor that fiber or ADSL coverage arrives, although the latter may indeed reach where fiber does not yet.

Movistar without permanence

Let’s start with the essential that gives title to this review of options for rural Internet: Movistar’s non-permanent rate. the blue attendant does not impose permanence on its fiber-only rates, such as Movistar Conecta. The best thing is that the service can be equivalent to ADSL and Internet Radio if you don’t have fiber coverage.

Movistar usually launches promotions with a 20% discount for 6 months in the 300 Mb mode. We have two options. On the one hand, 300 Mb fiber with landline with unlimited calls to national landlines, line fee included, free installation and Smart WiFi router for 24 euros per month for 12 months, after which the price will be 38 euros per month. On the other hand, if we need higher speed, the option of 600 Mb is also available for 44 euros per month of final price without promotion.

satellite internet

Companies like Eurona or Viasat do have a commitment to stay for 12 monthssince they require a more extensive installation than other cable Internet connections, so we are going to discard them automatically.

satellite internet

Our option here is SkyDSL, whose installation is not that complex and, therefore, they do not require permanence, but they do have an initial registration fee of 29.90 euros for activation/registration of the service. Once this amount has been paid, you will have three different satellite Internet rates, depending on the use you are going to make:

  • skyDSL2+ at home S: 12 Mbps download speed, 2 Mbps upload speed, maximum data transfer: 15 GB. It has a price of 16.90 euros per month.
  • skyDSL2+ at home M: 24 Mbps download speed, 1 Mbps upload speed, maximum data transfer: unlimited. It has a price of 26.90 euros per month.
  • skyDSL2+ at home L: 40 Mbps download speed, 2 Mbps upload speed, maximum data transfer: unlimited. It has a price of 29.90 euros per month.

Internet Wimax

Wimax Internet is a type of broadband connection that transmits data through radio waves and there are several options to enjoy this technology in remote rural areas.

wimax

One of the companies that offers Wimax connection in rural areas is called netllar. This operator has rates without a permanence period, but the initial installation costs range between 80 and 100 euros. Netllar has a presence in some areas of Andalusia, Asturias, Aragon, Extremadura and Murcia. You can get Internet up to 30Mb for 17 euros per month.

blaveo is another of the companies with a Wimax rate. In this you can choose between having up to 24 months of permanence or assume the registration and installation costs of 129 euros and get rid of said permanence. It has coverage in areas of Murcia, Castilla la Mancha, the Valencian Community, the Region of Murcia, Andalusia and Extremadura. It has 3 modalities: Wimax 12 MB for 14.90 euros per month, Wimax 20 MB for 17.90 euros per month or Wimax 20 MB + 40 GB shared for 27.80 euros.

4G at home without permanence

There are several companies that offer this service, as it can be easier to get access to a 4G cell tower than any other type of broadband installation.

4G at home Orange

Within this segment, for example, Orange offers 4G service at home. It has a permanence commitment by default, although they offer up to 3 alternatives: 12 months with the 4G Wi-Fi router on loan, 24 months with any other device for sale in installments or without a permanence commitment with a single payment. In this way, with a single payment we could later unsubscribe from Orange without much problem. With unlimited data and up to 150 Mbps speed, it is priced at 19.97 euros/month for 6 months and then 39.95 euros/month.
